title: Mason County board approves year-end budget amendments
title_page: Mason County board approves year-end budget amendments
maintext:
The Mason County Board of Commissioners Wednesday, as it does every December, approved many budget amendments before the year ends.
Among those amended budgets were the approval of the 2018 budgets for special revenue fund types and debt service fund types.
The board also approved 2017 budget amendments for the county’s general fund, special revenue funds and debt retirement funds.
Mason County Administrator Fabian Knizacky said the amended budgets will provide the same level of services in the county in the year that ends Sunday and in 2018.
Commissioner Tom Posma thanked the county’s employees and department heads for the excellent jobs they do with the board throughout the year to keep budget numbers down.
“Without their support, it’s hard to do,” Posma said.
Also on Wednesday, the board approved spending up to $24,485 to replace 7-year-old servers used by the Mason County Sheriff’s Office.
